intro: Ceratostema megabracteatum, commonly known as the giant bract ceratostema, is a striking member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to China and is characterized by its large, showy bracts that resemble petals, giving it a floral appearance. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often surrounded by the vibrant bracts. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections for its unique and eye-catching display.
